sub_title: Education, Emergency and Development Projects Consultant
summary:
- Development professional with over fifteen years work experience in national, regional and international settings
- Strengths include program management, training and curriculum development, partnership-building with government and civil society organizations, resource mobilization, sustainability, advocacy and communications
- Thematic areas:  learner-centred education, children’s rights with focus on education and protection, child and youth participation, life skills,financial education, entrepreneurship, sustainability education, community and network mobilisation

List of countries and  achievements 
- Mainstreaming programmes into government policies: integration of programmes into national policy (Croatia, Guinea-Bissau, Macedonia, Moldova, Turkey)

- Programmes in partnership with local government and NGOs: implementation of programmes with existing NGO partners and sub-regional government departments (Albania, Bosnia and Herzegovina, Bulgaria, Brazil, France, Mozambique, Serbia)

- Local and international NGOs - pilot programmes: collaboration with small local NGOs and national stakeholders (Angola, Czech Republic, Georgia, Germany, Iceland, Kosovo, Lithuania, Poland, Portugal, Romania)

projects.title: Turkey - Technical Team for Assignment of Ministry of Education - Extra curricular curriculum - supported by UNICEF Turkey
projects.description: This project is done in collaboration with Youth for Habitat Turkey and responds to a call from UNICEF Turkey and the Ministry of Education of Turkey. The aim is to develop manuals for children and families, with dedicated online training for teachers. The project will be focusing on Elementary School children, specially the most vulnerable ones, that attend extra-curricular activities. The theme of the extra-curricular curriculum is Social and Financial Education as a way to empower children in taking their own decisions and bring about change in their own lives and their communities.

contributors.headline: Education, Emergency and Development Projects Consultant

projects.title: Geração - Plan Brazil - Life Skills for young girls and boys - supported by Credit Suisse Bank
projects.description:
This project is implemented by Plan Brazil, with technical support of Aflatoun and sponsored by Credit Suisse. 
The objective of 'Generation Project' (Projeto Geração) is to ensure that girls and boys between 11 and 14 years old, become empowered to conclude their basic education and find transition opportunities to continue their development. The project will focus of developing social and financial lifeskills, encouraging the adolescents to develop their own social and financial enterprises in a safe and inclusive environment. The final aim is that the project is be able to support the students in transitioning from basic to high education.

projects.title: Aflateen Bulgaria-Social and Financial Education for Youth - supported by the European Investment Bank
projects.description: The goal of the Aflateen project is to deliver financial education courses to improve social and financial literacy skills of vulnerable groups. The pilot of this programme started in Bulgaria, Burgas, with teenagers (15-18 years old) selected form grades 8-12 in the Bulgarian school system. About 1600 students from the target population will participate in the pilot over two years. This project is supported by the European Investment Bank Institute.

contributors.headline: Education, Emergency and Development Projects Consultant

projects.title: Melhor de Mim - Child Labour Erradication Programme - Supported by Telefonica Foundation
projects.description:
Projeto em parceria com a Fundação Telefônica e 04 organizações de base comunitária, dedicado à contribuir para a erradicação do trabalho infantil em 04 municípios do Vale do Jequitinhonha. A metodologia adotada foi o Aflatoun - educação social e financeira para crianças e adolescentes.

Developed in partnership with Telefonica Foundation, the project main goal is to contribute for child labor erradication at 04 municipalities of Vale do Jequitinhona Region (Minas Gerais State, Brazil).

https://www.childfundbrasil.org.br/blog/projeto-melhor-de-mim-ja-colhe-frutos/

projects.title: PRECEDE - Peace building for Early Childhood Education - supported by European Union
projects.description:
The overall objective of the program is to support civil society's impact on the process of reconciliation and cohesion through education and development of young children in the Balkan region and Europe. The program will contribute to the development of a sustainable network of civil society organizations in the Balkans dealing with young children and to promote acceptance of others and respect for diversity; the development of a sustainable network of civil society organizations at the national level that promote acceptance of others and respect for diversity through early childhood education in the Western Balkans and connecting networks at national and precede network of civil society organizations with an international network of young children in conflict and post - conflict countries .

The organizations involved are: Center for Civic Initiatives (Croatia), Partnere per Femijet (Albania), Balkan Sunflowers (Kosovo *) First Children's Embassy in the world (Macedonia) and Early Years - Organization Nurseries (Early Years - the organization for young children, Northern Ireland). Aflatoun is involved in giving technical support when concerning social and financial education included in the toolkit.

profile_positions.description:
This project is funded by the World Bank in collaboration with the Ministry of Preschool Education of Uzbekistan. The objectives are to increase access to early childhood education, improve the 
quality of learning environments in selected public preschools, and enable a systematic measurement of 
education quality for informed decision-making.
profile_positions.title: ICDI Consultant on 'Promoting Early Childhood Development'

profile_positions.description: Technical Service Organisation is a group of technical experts within World Vision International located globally to support your technical sector’s development and emergency response needs. profile_positions.description:
From an interdisciplinary perspective drawing on sociology, political economy, anthropology, law and social history, issues like poverty, equity, rights and social development of children and youth were addressed. Analysis of children and youth’s roles in global or local development. Knowledge and focus on rights-based approaches.

I studied Child and Youth specialization and I engaged in several activities such as the Environment Committee, Arts Committee and an awareness group formed by students "Activitists for Alternative Awareness". I was also a volunteer member of the The Hague volunteer group of Amnesty International.
